posts.author: AmanoJyaku
posts.content:
Black Dragon of Chaos - Druid 24/Monk 6/Blackguard 10
Elf, Variable alignment (LN - LE)
PvM, playable 1-40? probably, but won't be easy. I'd like to think the end justifies the means.

The idea behind this was to have Dragon shape and exploit every synergy I could think of along the way.

PROS
Elf gives access to longbow from level 1, the higher Dex makes use of this from the start and adds extra AC to the end.
Zen Archery makes use of your high Wis as does the Monk AC bonus.
Monk gives access to Blackguard from the free Cleave feat.
10 levels of Blackguard brings an extra attack per round and 3d6 sneak attack, which in turn benefits from the free Improved Knockdown at Monk level 6.
This leaves 24 levels to put into Druid which, coincidentally, gives a bonus feat allowing Dragon Shape to be taken at level 40 so Wis can be left at 14 during character creation, giving extra points to be spent in Int and Cha (+80 skillpoints, +2 to all saving throws from Dark Blessing).
Owl's Insight lets you self buff to the cap, giving a +6 bonus to AC, AB (with bow) and will saves, just a pity you can't make use of the extra spell slot.

Unfortunately, while all this synergy is rather fun it does come at an eye-watering cost.

CONS
Xp penalty 20% from level 5 onwards.
Alignment changes aplenty (Lawful Neutral to Lawful Evil to Neutral to Evil and finally back Neutral again).  ~Requires access to an alignment manager~
380 hp is nothing to write home about.
Neither is the paltry 238 skillpoints.
Feats are....minimal.
24 levels for Spell Penetration isn't what you'd call hardcore.
No Dragon shape until level 40
And finally, your main weapon is a bow. Your opponents face may look like a porcupines arse, but the writing above their head says "barely injured".

Stats
STR 10
DEX 16
CON 10
INT 14
WIS 14 (30)
CHA 14

Leveling

02 Druid 2:

Skill Points: 238
Concentration 40 (40), Discipline 40 (40), Hide 5 (8), Spellcraft 43 (45), Tumble 40 (43), with 70 points left over. Don't spend them all on one skill.....

Final stats (mundane longbow shooting mundane arrows, clothes/rags/birthday suit/whatever)

AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 32/32
Max HP 380
BAB: 27 (4 APR, monk UBAB progression w/creature weapons)
AB, ranged: +40/+35/+30/+25 (+1 to attacks within 15 feet, +2 in woodland areas)
AB, melee: 27

Saves (vs. spells)
Fortitude 28 (37)
Reflex 23 (32)
Will 34 (43)
Add'l saves: Mind Effects: +4, Fear: +2

Immunities: All poisons, non-magical diseases, sleep, grease, web and entangle

Dragon stats (according to the character sheet, which apparently is wrong, so I'll post the "true" stats below)
AC 62
(true AC 60 - base 10, +10 Wis, +13 Dex, +20 Dodge, +8 Tumble, +1 Monk speed, -2 huge size)

Max HP 820 (920 inc. temporary hitpoints)

AB +46/+43/+40/+37/+34/+31
(true AB +50/+47/+44/+41/+38/+35 - base 27, +19 Str, +6 Claws, -2 huge size.)

Fortitude 39
Reflex 33
Will 34
Spell resistance 20

Additional immunities: Mind spells, paralysis, sneak attacks

Essentially you start off life as a Dex character without Weapon Finesse, so taking Point Blank Shot at level 1 allows you to use the longbow in close combat straight away, making use of your high Dex for attack bonus. I've taken Weapon Focus early on as the small boost is worth more at low levels.

Taking Zen Archery at level 15 is purely due to the timing of the shift from Dex to Wis giving the highest bonus, but to be honest, it doesn't really matter when you take it, especially if you plan on wearing Wis enhancing items. Monk levels are chosen to coincide with skill dumps into Tumble. Also, you'll need 5 points in Hide and the Cleave feat for Blackguard and I guess it won't hurt to have the AC and bonus Monk feats by the time you get Wild Shape and are ready to start throwing down in melee.

The 8 levels of Blackguard pre-epic is for the extra attack per round. Level 9 and 10 of Blackguard are essential to delay the Epic Druid bonus feat until WIS=30. Swap them for Monk and you get Wholeness of Body, which is complete pants, at the cost of +1d6 sneak attack. Between Blackguard and Druid summons you have an entire army of meat-shields at your disposal, who rather kindly also make your shots sneak attacks, so I'd rather have the extra damage.

Once you acquire elemental form you should be able to dish out a beating like a proper thug, with 6 attacks per round, +1 if you want to use flurry, Druid buffing spells and your heavies to give you sneak attacks. Shift back to elf and you can hit them with offensive spells or an arrow to the knee*.

At level 40 it shouldn't even be a question; you now have all the tools to re-enact the car door scene from that movie Lock, Stock.

After creating this I suddenly realised I should probably have a look for similar builds before posting and looking like a right twat. I could only see 1, available here: Tiamat's Claw by KailPendragon however, I feel mine is still different enough to warrant a look.

This is the first time I've posted a build, so all comments/criticism welcome, be brutal - I promise I won't cry.

*not actually to the knee

edit: per Hip 20160917 (corrections/additions of missing info, in red; relinked reference build)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
AmanoJyaku wrote:This is the first time I've posted a build, so all comments/criticism welcome, be brutal - I promise I won't cry.
A bold attitude!
OK here we go:
You spend 4 pre epic feats and one epic feat on archery, and still (in your own words): "Your opponents face may look like a porcupines arse, but the writing above their head says "barely injured"."
Zen archery should be enough to keep ranged combat as an option. This is not an archer build.
All your available shifted forms override strength, dexterity and constitution. Keep them low and invest primarily in wisdom. Wisdom is good for your spells, for your AC and for earlier access to Dragon shape.
You should still have points available to buy intelligence and charisma, if you want that.
A low dexterity means that you can pick human over elf for more skillpoints and and an extra feat. That will also cure your 20% XP penalty.
Building with 3 classes that all have alignment restrictions, leaves you with several alignment shifts to handle. If you can adjust the alignment where you play, that's OK. But if not, then the build is not achievable.
Between the 3 classes, the 10 levels of BG are the less productive, power wise. More and earlier Druid development would be stronger and easier to level with the spellpower and earlier access to shapes.

What you call synergy, im my eyes you simply want too much in. That more often than not weakens the build.

posts.author: AmanoJyaku
posts.content:
Excellent! Thank you so much for your suggestions, er, Mr. Dagger, although in hindsight some things were fairly obvious (bow feats - what was I thinking?), however my hasty test has also provided some unexpected results. I need to investigate further, too many changes at once, too many variables. If I ever come up with something worth posting I'll update you.

Alas, you have also hit upon my true problem when it comes to builds - I want too much! I know I can't have it all though, it wouldn't be fun otherwise.

BTW, love the name/avatar combination.

posts.content:
AmanoJyaku wrote:Alas, you have also hit upon my true problem when it comes to builds - I want too much! I know I can't have it all though, it wouldn't be fun otherwise.
Been there, done that - and I believe that goes for most of us.

Click here

Take it EZ!

posts.author: AmanoJyaku
posts.content:
Wow, what a wealth of information right there! Thank you Mr Kane, for linking that (and for writing the damn thing in the first place, obviously!) Also, loved your build http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 04912.html that was a total beast.

Any thoughts on dropping a few monk levels with this one? But then I'd lose KD/IKD. Or I could boost monk to 9 for Improved Evasion. Is it worth it? I could lower Druid to just 18 (like your very own Forsaken Dragon) and have more Monk and Blackguard for IE and an extra +1d6 sneak attack, at a cost of Elder Elemental shape and spell DC (although factoring in Mr Daggers suggested improvements allows for Greater Spell Penetration, so it's not quite as bad as it first seems).

Totally off topic, and don't take this the wrong way, has anyone ever mentioned how annoying your signature is to Brits? (OK, maybe just this Brit) I always have to read it twice - once as "eee-zed" then I'm like "wait, it's zee, damn it, not again!". Don't change it though! I just wish I could come up with something using the *correct* pronunciation, but people would probably just get confuZ.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Funny, I wasn't expecting that build to be mentioned, if anything I'd expect you to like this one, which is much better. The one you mentioned is GREAT, but it suffers greatly with dispellability and has one alignment shift. I built that one in my early days, but looking at it now, it's very strong only if not dispelled, and when a Druid gets dispelled, it REALLY HURTS, especially if you are shifted.

I wouldn't cut back on Monk, in the one I linked here I did because I had CoT bonus feats with which to take KD and IKD, but in yours there aren't any, so it's not worth it. Neither would I cut the Druid aspect of it. You will be a great caster, and none of the other classes will give you anything worthwhile to compensate what you'll lose in terms of caster levels and spells, and shapes and bonus feats, for not going with more Druid. IMO, 6 Monk and 24 Druid is fine.

Funny you say this about my signature, I'm Brazilian and I teach English for a living. One of my former colleagues at the course I quit this year is British and he and I used to bust each other's chops with the whole "driving on the wrong side" thing. He also used to say: you don't speak English, you speak American. LOL

Take it EZED man (whatever that means )!

posts.author: AmanoJyaku
posts.content:
Hahahaha! You really made me laugh with that last comment, brilliant man!

Also, thanks for the advice, and of course I do like the CoT build too, especially like the whole casting epic spells in Dragon form. It almost doesn't seem fair I could never bring myself to drop the zen archery though, anything else is up for discussion, but it just feels wrong not to make use of the high WIS. I can always find 1 pre-epic feat that can go.

Thanks again man, and take it E-zed yourself

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
In my build, you can also drop 2 Great Wisdoms and move 2 CoT pre-epic, delaying Dragon Shape to 33 and gaining 2 pre-epic feats and +1 BAB, which in my design would be Disarm and Improved Disarm, but there's no reason why it can't also be Zen Archery +1 (Improved Critical Longbow?). That would also make pre-epic leveling A LOT harder because you won't get Elemental Shape till epics.

As for your build, I'd follow Mick's guidelines. You don't want to invest in ANY physical stat in a non-shifter Druid build because they get overridden by ALL OF YOUR SHAPES. I'd also keep Druid at least at 24 for maximum Owl's Insight benefits. I question the usefulness of 10 BG levels in this build. It does give you Sneak Attack and all, but I wonder if the cost is worth it. An alternative spread could be Druid 24 Monk 9 BG 7. You'd lose 1d6 SA and 1 BAB, but you'd gain +30% Speed bonus from Monk Speed, Improved Evasion and Wholeness of Body, while still keeping a full attack schedule as long as at least 4 BG levels are taken pre-epic, which is better IMO.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
Welcome to the guild AmanoJyaku!

I also wonder the use of BG in this build as it doesn't seem to take advantage of what the class can offer.

As long as you're talking exploit, you could go Paladin instead of BG...and do Druid 24 / Paladin 15 / Monk 1. Since you would drop some of the Longbow feats per the above advice, you could take KD, IKD and Epic Prowess. Take Monk at lvl 40 and you don't have to worry about the XP penalty, go Human as Mick said to get more skills and an extra feat and Paladin early on opens up all Martial Weapons (and Heavy Armor if you're so inclined). You lose the Sneak Attacks and Bull's STR from BG but you get Divine Favor, Aid, Bless, and Prayer to help with damage; keep the +2 to saves; and immunity to fear.

Also, Taunt is a must (and Expertise if you have room for it). BG and Paladin have Taunt as a class skill so grab it!

Plus Alignment changes only need to be LG to LN/NG

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content: An illegal combo in just about all environments except high-magic which sometimes have an alignment manager to expedite concepts like this.  My sweet bardic monk idea from years ago is another "wishful thinking" concept that isn't worth indulging since it flies in the face of v3.0 which I happen to enjoy "as is".  And I despise playing on the item grab high-magic worlds because almost every build works the same.
